title_sort: reuben farwell to walt whitman, 11 february 1875
title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 11 February 1875
text: Feb 11th 1875I received your Postal Card Feb-5-1875But you have not forgoten[forgotten] your littel[little] Michigan friend yetâ€”Well i have not forgotton[forgotten] my Hospital Friend yet and I hope that I never willI read in the newspaper that you had been sick but I trust that you have got well againI had a shock of Paralasis[paralysis] on the right side of my person I was layed[laid] up three weeks you see I can not write as I used too[to] before I was afflicted. I am not abel[able] to work on my farm and I have rented it for 5 years Well Walt I think I will go to California next fall is noth[nothing] hapens[happens]This is the first letter I have writen[written] since this accidence[accident] hapand[happened]I will writ[write] better one next timeGood by[bye] God Bless my old acquaintance Walt WhitmanYours TrulyRuben[Reuben] FarwelladdressNankin P.Wayne CoMichiganYou see that it bothers me some to make lettersExcuse all mistaks[mistakes]Reuben FarwellFeb. 11 '75 Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 11 February 1875
